question: What is the maximum home loan I can afford with an annual income of $75,000 and existing monthly debts of $500?
true_answer: With $75,000 income and $500 monthly debts, maximum loan approximately $312,000, assuming 30% DTI.

steps.content: What is the maximum home loan I can afford with an annual income of $75,000 and existing monthly debts of $500?
Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent for affordability analysis. 2) Use calculator for DTI. 3) Supervisor review. 4) Return answer.
Retrieving knowledge on home loan affordability calculations.
Common affordability uses 28-36% of gross monthly income for housing costs.
Calculating maximum loan amount using income and debt data.
Gross monthly income is $6,250. Using 30% DTI, maximum housing cost is $1,875.
Subtracting $500 monthly debt, available for mortgage is $1,375.
Converting monthly payment to loan amount assuming 4% interest over 30 years.
Calculated maximum loan amount is approximately $312,000.
What if interest rates increase to 5%?
At 5% interest, maximum loan amount reduces to approximately $275,000.
With $75,000 income and $500 monthly debts, maximum loan approximately $312,000, assuming 30% DTI. At 5% interest, it reduces to $275,000.
